RLT 4.2.0
  • Reference 

                Survival random forest with covariance estimation

    Surv_Cov_Forest.Rd

          These trees will always be sampled without replacement.
                   The choices of tuning parameters will be limited.
                   Use at your own risk.

    Usage

    Surv_Cov_Forest(
  x,
  y,
  censor,
  testx,
  ntrees = 10000,
  mtry = max(1, as.integer(ncol(x)/3)),
  nmin = max(1, as.integer(log(nrow(x)))),
  split.gen = "best",
  nsplit = 0,
  resample.prob = 0.5,
  param.control = list(),
  ncores = 1,
  verbose = 0,
  seed = NULL,
  ...
)

    Arguments

    x

    A matrix or data.frame of features

    y

    Response variable. a numeric/factor vector.

    censor

    The censoring indicator if survival model is used.

    testx

    A matrix or data.frame of testing data

    ntrees

    Number of trees. To obtain a stable and accurate estimation, the default is ntrees = 10000.

    mtry

    Number of randomly selected variables used at each internal node.

    nmin

    Terminal node size. Same as used in RLT.

    split.gen

    "random", "rank" or "best".

    nsplit

    Number of random cutting points to compare for each variable at an internal node.

    resample.prob

    Proportion of in-bag samples.

    param.control

    A list of additional parameters. However, choices are limited. For example, reinforcement splitting rules are not implemented.

    ncores

    Number of cores. Default is 0 (using all available cores).

    verbose

    Whether fitting info should be printed.

    seed

    Random seed number to replicate a previously fitted forest. Internally, the xoshiro256++ generator is used. If not specified, a seed will be generated automatically.

    ...

    Additional arguments.

    Value

               Prediction and covariance estimation of the testing data

    On this page
